subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * Note that the {{w|Traditional Chinese|traditional form}} contains {{l|mul|𦥑}} (7 strokes) while Japanese {{w|kyūjitai}}, Korean {{w|Hanja}}, Vietnamese {{w|History of writing in Vietnam|Nom}} and mainland China's standardized form ({{w2|zh|新字形#新旧字形对照表|新字形}}, {{w|Xin Zixing}}) contains {{l|mul|臼}} (6 strokes) instead. Both of these forms are encoded under the same [[code point]]. This character may appear to be either 搜 or 搜 depending on the fonts available. * A {{w|CJK Compatibility Ideographs|CJK compatibility ideograph}} exist at U+FA8E for the alternative Korean form which contains {{l|mul|𦥑}} (7 strokes).
